103.heading: Rupprecht, Philipp, 1900-1975.
103.title: Jews Introduce Themselves , and, Without Solution of the Jewish Question No Salvation of the German Folk = Juden Stellen sich Vor, und, ohne Lösung der Judenfrage keine Erlösung des Deutschen Volkes.
103.author: [No author]
notes: In English and German.

Summary: Antisemitic caricatures, cartoons and quotes taken from Der Stürmer. The caricatures and cartoons were the work of Philipp Rupprecht, a German cartoonist whose antisemitic works frequently appeared in Der Stürmer under the pen-name "Fips."

110.title: Ruptures
110.author: drawing, Serge Pellé ; script, Sylvain Runberg ; translator, Jerome Saincantin.
notes: (Orbital ; 2)
Translated from the French: Orbital 2: Ruptures.

"Caleb (a human) and Mezoke (a Sandjarr) are paired up as special agents to keep the intergalactic peace. This is a controversial and historic alliance given their races' longstanding enmity, and a lot of people are watching. Their first mission is to keep war from breaking out between humans and Javlodes on the planet Senestam. Caleb acts as a mediator between the warring factions while dealing with an attack by highly destructive insects called Stilvulls
and he also has to contend with his feelings for charming doctor Kim Vandersel. Meanwhile, Mezoke is on the planet Upssal, trying to appease the Javlodes."

142.title: Rurouni Kenshin : Restoration

notes: (Shonen Jump Manga)

"During the violent upheaval of the Bakumatsu era, Hitokiri Battosai was a feared and ruthless assassin. But now that the Meiji Restoration has begun to heal the wounds of civil war, Battosai has taken up a new name and a new calling. He is now Himura Kenshin, a rurouni wanderer who has vowed to only draw his sword to protect those in need. But not everyone is pleased with Kenshin's new direction and enemies from his dark past have vowed to bring him down."

182.heading: Ruses.
182.title: "The Strange Signs at Saddle Rock"
182.author: script, Gardner Fox ; art, Howard Sherman ; letters, Joe Letterese
notes: Summary: Riding through Saddle Rock, Wyoming is confused to find every business is named after him, since he has never been there before. He's told that the townspeople use his name as a deterrent to outlaws. But Wyoming notices that the signs are all freshly painted, and discovers it's a ruse to cover up the fact that outlaws already run the town and the townspeople are prisoners.
Data from Gene Reed, Mike Tiefenbacher, Ed Boner, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

184.title: "Ruses de Guerre" p. 60 in Gros et Détail : album par Caran d'Ache
184.author: [No author]

185.title: "Les Ruses de Gustave Doré"
185.author: Harry Morgan
185.appears_in: p. 84-91 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 3 (Jan. 1998).
notes: (Gustave Doré)

Begins: "En 1854, la question d'Orient entre dans une nouvelle phase. La Russie attaque la Turquie. La France et l'Angleterre envoient un corps expéditionnaire en Crimée. Face à l'actualité, le jeune Gustave Doré commence par exécuter quelques spirituelles charges anti-russes dans le style du 'Charivari.' Puis, avec la prolixité et l'ambition qui le charactérisent, il décide de réaliser un histoire 'illustrée de 500 dessins,' dont le but est de décrire la Russie comme un cloaque, l'histoire russe comme une succession de massacres et les souverains russes comme des tortionnaires sadiques. L'Histoire de la Sainte Russie est de loin, la plus longue histoire en images du XIXe siècle, comme le note David Kunzle. C'est assez dire son importance."

English summary (from p. 139): "Gustave Doré's Tricks. Harry Morgan rereads L'Histoire de la Sainte Russie and takes a close look at the strategies Doré uses, and often invents, to obtain comic effect. He highlights the originality of his contribution to the nascent art of comics without hiding its limitations."

227.heading: Rushing.
227.title: "It's Much Hipper to be Lesbian"
227.author: by Garry Trudeau.
notes: Summary: Mark is staying with J.J. and Mike during his coming out, and J.J. offers to take him to hang out with her gay friends; Mike says not to rush him, and J.J. says she thought she was a lesbian a few years ago.

228.heading: Rushing.

notes: Soireé's performance is a hit, but Nathan finds Ruben in the men's room with another man and rushes Richard away so he won't see.

235.title: Rushing the Stage. "Pining Away for Kudzu Dubose"
235.author: Marlette.
notes: Summary: Ida Mae Wombat reads her essay about her Summer vacation, which included computer camp, selling dental floss door-to-door, rushing the stage when Leonard Nimoy appeared at an sf convention in Atlanta, and writing Kudzu's name in magic markers all over her loose-leaf notebook.
